model_outputs.question:
The following translations from German to English contain a particular error. That error will be one of the following types: Named Entities: An entity (names, places, locations, etc.) is changed to a different entity. Numerical Values: Numerical values (ordinals or cardinals), dates, and/or units are changed. Modifiers or Adjectives: The modifiers and adjectives pertaining to a noun are changed. Negation or Antonyms: Introduce or remove a negation or change comparatives to their antonyms. Facts: Trivial factual errors not pertaining to the above classes are introduced in the translations. Dropped Content: A significant clause in the translation is removed. Please identify that error.  Source: Karl Borromäus Joseph Fürst von Liechtenstein war ein kaiserlicher Feldmarschall.
Translation: Charles Borromeo Joseph Prince of Liechtenstein was an judicial field marshal.
The translation contains an error pertaining to
Options:
(A) Modifiers or Adjectives
(B) Numerical Values
(C) Negation or Antonyms
(D) Named Entities
(E) Dropped Content
(F) Facts
model_outputs.model_answer:
The translation contains an error pertaining to (A) Modifiers or Adjectives. Specifically, in "judicial field marshal", the adjective "judicial" does not properly describe "field marshal". It should be "military" or "naval"
Here is the correct translation, using "military": Charles Borromeo Joseph Prince of Liechtenstein was a military field marshal.

In this translation, there is no error pertaining to:
* Naming - the name is not changed (e.g. from Karl to Charles)
* Numerical values - the rank (field marshal) has not changed
* Modifiers or adjectives - the adjective "judicial" has been replaced with a more appropriate one
* Negation or Antonyms - the translation does not inclued a negation or the antonym of a positive statement
* Dropped content - no clauses of statements are missing in translation
* Facts - the translation does not contain any factual errors that were not present in the original text.

model_outputs.question:
The following translations from German to English contain a particular error. That error will be one of the following types: Named Entities: An entity (names, places, locations, etc.) is changed to a different entity. Numerical Values: Numerical values (ordinals or cardinals), dates, and/or units are changed. Modifiers or Adjectives: The modifiers and adjectives pertaining to a noun are changed. Dropped Content: A significant clause in the translation is removed. Please identify that error.  Source: Artemisia ist eine Pflanzengattung in der Familie der Korbblütler.
Translation: Artemisia is a genus of plants in the family Artemisia.
The translation contains an error pertaining to
Options:
(A) Modifiers or Adjectives
(B) Numerical Values
(C) Negation or Antonyms
(D) Named Entities
(E) Dropped Content
(F) Facts
model_outputs.model_answer:
The translation contains an error pertaining to (A) Modifiers or Adjectives.
The correct translation should be: "Artemisia is a genus of plants in the family of Artemisia."

The translated noun "genus" should be considered an adjective, and "of Artemisia" should be considered the noun it is modifying.
In this case, it would be more fitting to move "of" before the noun "Artemisia."

This switch would allow the sentence to start with the noun, which is often preferred in English.
Note that this switch is one of many possible changes that may have been used to create the translated sentence.
As there are many possible ways to create a correct translation, the answer may be different depending on the translator.
Note that the original sentence contained the noun-phrase "der Korbblütler," which is a group noun that is often translated as "the daisy family" in American English.

If factual mistakes or other errors do not invalidate the translation as a whole, these details allow the English to adequately describe the German sentence.
This example showcases how adjusting modifiers or adjectives can go a long way towards creating a proper translation.
In such cases, noun and noun phrase shifts may be required to best reflect the sentence.
This general point is true for multiple different language pairs and sentence structures.

Dropped Content: A significant clause in the translation is removed. Please identify that error.  Source: Viele deutsche Nationaldenkmäler des 19.
Translation: Many German national monuments of the 190th century
The translation contains an error pertaining to
Options:
(A) Modifiers or Adjectives
(B) Numerical Values
(C) Negation or Antonyms
(D) Named Entities
(E) Dropped Content
(F) Facts
model_outputs.model_answer:
(D) Named Entities

The error in the translation is "Viele deutsche Nationaldenkmäler des 19." The noun "Nationaldenkmäler" is translated to "national monuments" and the noun "deutsche" is translated to "German". What is problematic here is that the word "Nationaldenkmäler" is plural. As such, the adjective "German" should be in its plural form "Germans" to agree with the noun. Moreover, the English word "Nationaldenkmäler" is a noun, not an adjective, as is the related English noun "National Monument".
However, in this case, it is possible that the intended meaning was to say "many German national monuments" rather than "many German national monument". If so, the English phrase would be "a national monument". However, the source is "Viele deutsche Nationaldenkmäler des 19", which could be expected to refer to "German national monuments", or is better understood to refer to " monuments in Germany from the 19th century". It is possible that the translation should have been "many national monuments in Germany from the 19th century", but without context it is difficult to reconstruct what the translator intended to mean.

model_outputs.model_answer:
(B)
The translation contains a numerical value error. Nordi is said to be a Midfielder. This places emphasis on Nordi's field position. However, the correct answer should be that Nordi plays as a Central Midfielder. Central Midfielders are Midfielders who play in the center of the field, and usually try to score goals, Defensive Midfielders are Midfielders that don't play towards the center, and Specialist Midfielders can be attacking, defensive, or centre mids. Central Midfielders' Critical Passing stats should be around 80-90, whereas a Close-Range Finishing stat of up to 40 is also useful, together with impressive Jumping stats which allow players to rise above defenders to challenge crosses into goal. Other important stats include acceleration and sprint speed to allow players to reach and threaten attacking areas; however, a north African pro, Central Midfielders of African descent have better ball-winning percentages in defensive duels due to their physical capabilities, whereas more pace would open up passing lanes. Close-Controlled Passing was introduced in Be a Pro mode as a skill that could be trained but is not available in other game modes. Improving overall Passing attributes also rates highly and is always an important stat for midfielders.
